intro: Heptapleurum multiramosum, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its dense, glossy foliage and branching structure. The plant typically has alternate, ovate to elliptical leaves that are dark green and often have a waxy texture. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, followed by red berries that are edible for birds. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
